title: A Study of plot in Arnold Bennett's the Old wive's tale
abstract: This thesis is a study of plot in Arnold Bennett 's The old wives ' Tale . The author shows the role of setting, character and conflict in the development of the plot. The setting gives details of the story. Without setting, there would be vagueness. This means that the setting necessary to describe the story. The important thing is that the setting leads the readers to the plot. The contribution of setting to the plot is discussed in the second chapter of this thesis writing. Through the characters, the parental influence and its effects are shown clearly in this novel. Besides, the description of the major characters which have contrasting traits prepares the readers to the conflict . The external and internal conflict which happen between the characters are really needed to move the plot . All of these facts are discussed in the third and fourth chapter. This thesis is then, concluded that the plot of this novel becomes interesting for it is supported by the existence of setting, characters and conflict .
